text: My legal name is Steven Rogers, and I have been milking the fame of Captain America for all its worth haha!
author: StevenTravelCaptainRogers

text: I find Captain America the most sympathetic...every other avenger has traits that are plain unlikable, even detestable, except for Captain...though it took him decades to go from jingoistic puppet to developed character.
author: Flammiedrum

text: Actually, Captain America was never a jingoinistic puppet. He has twice given up being Captain America, becoming first the "Nomad" and again as "the Captain", because he could not answer blindly to the government. That was in the 70's-80's. He has his principles and morals that make him the heart of the Avengers like Superman of the JLA. A general once asked him about his loyalty. Cap answered: I am loyal to nothing, general-but the dream.
author: foldabotZ

text: makes me think of mega man 5, like some kind of cross of charge man and star man.
author: Chris Taylor

text: On arcade I enjoyed this game.
author: DTMTroy

text: Miura isn't a composer, he was a sound designer back at Data East. :)
author: Shad G

text: Having watched all the recent movies featuring the different Avengers, I have to say Captain America is my least favorite. He's just not as impressive as the others. This game was an average platformer (the NES version was different than all the other versions) but it had a couple catchy themes. My favorite Avenger is probably Hulk!
author: SupraDarky

text: I have to agree. I thought Captain America's movie was the weakest out of the lot. (though I haven't seen Hulk's so I can't say so for his)
author: Dalton McBleh

text: I know this video is a little old now but SupraDarky, you gotta admit that Cap America 2 was pretty badass.
